Title: New Xenosporium from Taiwan
Keywords:
Dematiaceous hyphomycetes, dictyospores, Dothideomycetes,
freshwater fungi, systematics, Tubeufiaceae
Abstract:
Three species of Xenosporium producing ellipsoidal or
ovoid conidia were collected from decaying culms of Miscanthus
floridulus submerged in a freshwater stream of Alishan area, Chiayi
County, Taiwan. Xenosporium formosaforme and X. parvulum are described
and illustrated as new species. Xenosporium africanum is described in
this paper as a new record for Taiwan. The phylogenetic relationship of
Xenosporium species and related taxa were sought by comparing the
sequences of their nuc rDNA ITS1-5.8S- ITS2 (ITS barcode). Phylogenetic
analysis of these Xenosporium species supports their placement in the
Tubeufiaceae. A synopsis of Xenosporium species producing ellipsoidal or
ovoid conidia is given. The criteria used to differentiate species are
discussed.
